availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
XVI.
AGRICULTURE
COMMERCE.
State of Tennesee,
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT.
To his Excellency the Governor of the State of Kentucky

Sir: It has been made known to me that a certain John Davis, of our County of Davidson, stands charged with having, in the month of May, 1865, committed grand Larceny by stealing a large amount of groceries as will more fully appear from an authenticated copy of an affidavit hereto annexed & herewith transmitted: And whereas, it has been made known to me that the said John Davis has fled from justice, and is now running at large in the State of Kentucky:

Now, Therefore, I, William G. Brownlow, Governor of the State of Tennessee, in pursuance of the Act of Congress, entitled "An Act to respecting Fugitives from Justices," do hereby demand that your Excellency will please cause the said John Davis to be arrested, if to be found within the limits of the State over which you preside, and have him safely delivered to S. P. Smith, who is appointed Agent on the part of this State to receive the said fugitive from the civil authorities of the State of the state of Tennesee Kentucky, to the end that he may be brought to the State of Tennessee and dealt with according to law.

figure.ab:
THE GREAT SEAL OF THE STATE OF TENNESEE
XVI.
AGRICULTURE
COMMERCE
1796

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused the Great Seal of the State to be affixed, at Nashville, on the 28th day of June, 1865.

BY THE GOVERNOR:
W. G. Brownlow
A. J. Fletcher
SECRETARY OF STATE.

Requisition
Gov Tennessee
for Fugitive
Warrant issued
1st July 1865
